Rotor wirings from codesandciphers.co.uk/enigma

This app uses the WheelView widget, created by Yuri Kanivets
Are you sure you want to clear the input box?
The Enigma machine can only encrypt letters. Any numerals or special characters in the message will be ignored. Would you like to proceeed?

The Enigma machine is a rotor-based cipher machine that was first patented in Germany in 1918. It was adopted for use by the various branches of the German military between 1925 and 1930, and continued to be used throughout WWII.


HOW TO USE

Choose your starting position for each rotor on this screen and your settings on the other screens. Be sure to remember all the settings or agree on them beforehand, or the recipient won’t be able to read your message! Type in the text you wish to encipher/decipher and press Run. You can now copy the text below the gray box and send it to someone, but if they don’t know which settings to use they won’t be able to read the message, even if they have this app!
Are you sure you want to reset EVERYTHING?
Are you sure you want to reset the rotor positions?\n(This won\'t clear the input box)
Are you sure you want to reset the rotors and reflector?

HOW TO USE\n\nChoose the reflector, rotors, and ring settings for each rotor on this screen. These settings are just as important as the settings on the other screens, so remember them or agree on them ahead of time!
HOW TO USE\n\nPick letters to swap while enciphering/deciphering here. These settings are important too, so make sure to remember them or agree on them before you start sending messages!
Are you sure you want to reset the steckerboard plugs?
